name: Lady Godiva. (E. Lisle)
description:
A Own Version of Lady Godiva, by John Collier, ca 1897.
In this painting, oil was used, with a traditional technique on an A3 sheet.
The challenge was to paint such an immense work in a small space.

Giving my own vision of light to the story of Lady Godiva, a woman who agreed to ride naked just to lower taxes on her vassals.

How much light should have existed in this woman to bare her body for others.

It is something that my version of Lady Godiva tries to represent.
